Legal_Issue: Whether the 'rolling' Anton Piller Order was properly granted and infringed on defendants' rights
Evidence_Assessment: Plaintiffs failed to prove serious damage or likelihood of evidence destruction
Burden_of_Proof: Plaintiffs failed to meet burden of proving serious damage and risk of evidence destruction
Legal_Rule: An Anton Piller Order requires proof of serious damage, likelihood of evidence destruction, and proper use of 'John Doe' proceedings
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged infringement of copyright in the film '3 Idiots'
Outcome_on_Merits: Action dismissed due to lack of evidence and procedural misuse
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Process undermined by improper use of legal procedures
Applicant_Challenge: Plaintiffs sought a 'rolling' Anton Piller Order
Defendant_Response: Requested review of ex parte order
Remedy_Sought: Anton Piller Order for seizure of materials
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Lack of proof of serious damage
Applicable_Process: Ex parte application followed by judicial review
